roleset.name: give a response, reaction, response
roleset.note: REACT-V NOTES: 'react' based on sentences in financial subcorpus; 'reactionary' based on BOLT-1. Verbnet class 31.3. Minimal comparison with 'answer' and 'respond'. (from react.01-v)
REACTION-N NOTES: Roleset based on react.01. Verbnet class marvel-31.3. Framed by Katie (from reaction.01-n)
REACTIVE-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from reactive.01-j)

roles.note: ArgM-MNR and Arg2 can be hard to distinguish. Use the following ruleof thumb--if something is an adverb (X-ly) or can be easily restated --> --as an adverb ("with caution -- > cautiously") call it ArgM-MNR.Otherwise use Arg2. (from react.01-v)

example.name: react-v: intransitive
example.text: Not everyone is reacting so calmly.

example.name: react-v: transitive, adverbial reaction
example.text: The stock market reacted strongly to the news.

example.name: react-v: transitive, arg2 reaction
example.text: Investors -- taking this as a sign that a broad industry slump was in the offing -- reacted by selling the company's stock, which lost $3.25 that day to close at $52 in national over-the-counter trading.
example.arg: -- taking this as a sign that a broad industry slump was in the offing --
by selling the company's stock, which lost $3.25 that day to close at $52 in national over-the-counter trading

example.name: reaction-n: Arg 2 as value
example.text: Analysts and consultants had mixed reactions to yesterday 's announcements

example.name: reaction-n: Example with args 0 and 1
example.text: The human reaction to such an excessive event

roleset.name: opposed to progressive reforms, very conservative
roleset.note: REACTIONARY-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from reactionary.01-j)
